about_me.des: I am a data scientist specialized in Big Data. I have experience with the Hadoop ecosystem, specially using Spark. I excel at exploring and cleaning data in order to apply machine learning algorithms to unveil its secrets. I love working across different teams in order to enable improvements due to collaboration. I am also curious by nature and love to explore new technologies and domains in order to keep learning.

projects.imbalance: Repository with different resources that add some useful funcionalities to Spark ML when dealing with unbalanced datasets.
projects.uni: Repository with some of the coding projects completed during my BSc in Maths and Computer Science and my MSc in Data Science.
projects.contest: Repository with the code submitted to some programming contests I have participated in.
projects.shiny: My first project created in Shiny to test its funcionalities.

career.ey_des: In January 2018, I started working at the Wavespace innovation center in Madrid as a data scientist and data engineer. Most of my work has been building the data infraestructure for a multi-national investment company based in UK in order to move all the company's decion making data into a Big Data cluster that will give them competive advantage in their sector and make them leaders in their market. I have also participated in smaller projects building chatbots for the banking sector.
career.qliro_des: In February 2017, I started working at Qliro, a leader online payments provider in the Nordics. I was part of the BI team and my main job consited in creating ETL jobs in Scala for migrating data from MS SQL to Hadoop. After some months working there I started to carry on my master thesis about fraud detection in collaboration with the fraud team. The outcome of this project was an automatic fraud detection system developed using Spark ML that leveraged machine learning algorithms to ease the work of the fraud investigators.
career.hack_des: In December 2016 I participated at the first edition of the hackathon HackSociety and our team won the first place of the FotoNation challenge. Our winner program converted a laptop into a touch screen for drawing flow diagrams using two low quality cameras and a regular pencil.
career.kth_des: From September 2016 to August 2017 I was doing my EIT Digital Data Science Master specialization in Distributed Systems and Data Mining for Really Big Data at KTH. I wrote a master thesis about fraud detection using Big Data in collaboration with Qliro and a minor thesis about business regarding a competitive analysis of BI tools.
career.summer: EIT Summer School about Smart Spaces, Helsinki
career.summer_des: In August 2016, I participated in the EIT Summer School about Smart Spaces that was held in Helsinki during two weeks. The classes were oriented to create a business plan about a smart spaces startup idea paying a special attention to solving real customer pains.
career.indizen_des: In May 2016, I started an Internship with Indizen as part of its Big Data department. I was involved in a project that consisted in analyzing geolocated social media data to detect news happening in real time and visualize them in a map of Barcelona. This data could be used to enhance newpapers teams in charge of detecting news. This project was developed in Python using Elasticsearch and Kibana in AWS.
career.vaciatucasa_des: In March 2016 I developed a Point of Sale sofware program for Vaciatucasa. This company needed a simple POS system to enable street market sells.
career.upm_des: In September 2016, I started my Data Science master in Madrid as part of the EIT Digital double degree program. Here I took basic courses about data mining, machine learning and distributed systems. We also took introductory courses about Business Innovation and Entrepreneurship as part of my minor, which plays a very important role in EIT Digital master programs.
career.crida_des: In May 2015 I started working at CRIDA as a developer in the context of Eurpean Air Trafic Control projects. I was in charge of designing ETL processes to load raw sources received daily into the company database. I also did data analysis and database maintenance. As a side project I created in Java a program that split audio files from airport control towers according to their silence gaps.
career.ies_des: From March 2015 to May 2015 I was giving classes about databases to exchange American students.
career.math: Applied Math Department at UPM, Madrid
career.math_des: From December 2014 to March 2015 I developed ContestMaker, a graphic app in Java, using Processing, which eased the process of creating interdisciplicary student contests. I was in charge of gathering all the questions created by the students from twelve different subjects. The contest gave the student extra points in the subjects for creating the questions, enabled collaboration across student from different courses, and the best team in the competition won additional points.
career.degree_des: From September 2011 to July 2015 I was pursuing my Bachelor's Degree in Mathematics and Informatics. This program focused in the interrelationship between the two disciplines, giving the students the necessary tools to solve problems in multiple scientific, technological and business fields.

publications.kth_title: Fraud detection in online payments using Spark ML
publications.kth_data: Master Thesis, Royal Institute of Technology (KTH), Stockholm, Sweden, 2017.
publications.upm_title: Presencia en Twitter de los candidatos a las elecciones madrile침as de 2015
publications.upm_data: BSc thesis, E.T.S. de Ingenieros Inform치ticos (UPM), Madrid, Spain, 2015.
